taxon_identification.taxon_hierarchy: family rosaceae;tribe rubeae;genus rubus;subgenus eubatus;section arguti;species mollior;

treatment.description: Stiff, erect, up to 1.7 m. high, with broad-based arching hard prickles up to 6 mm. long; primocane-leaves becoming very thick, and coriaceous, with the veins impressed above and very prominent and rib-like beneath, the upper surface glabrous but scabridulous, the lower at first soft-pubescent but becoming hard to the touch; leaflets ovate-oblong or oval, the terminal one on a short petiolule 1-3 cm. long; raceme rather short, its lowest pedicels 1-2 cm. long; corolla 2-3 cm. broad; fruit short-oblong.
treatment.habitat_elevation_distribution_or_ecolog: S. Mo. and Kans., s. to Ark. and Okla.
